title: "What is the Origin of Humanity and its Evolutionary Path?" - A Discussion on the Evolution of Species and the Survival of the Fittest.
first_phrase: In this text, the author discusses the concept of the origin and the different directions that species can take, using imagery of a conquest. The surviving group continues to fight and finally achieves its goal, while other attempts fail and are left behind. The author highlights that humans, as we know them today, evolved from a primordial humanity consisting of various animal species. The author emphasizes that the achievement of a goal always comes after various necessary conditions, and the human form is the result of conservation in the material world.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the path to success is often wrought with many failed attempts and frustrations. However, those who persevere and stay true to their course eventually reach their intended destination. Let us remember that the human form is a representation of the evolution of our primordial ancestors, and our ability to reach our goals sets us apart from the animal kingdom.
